intro: Agalmyla kowapiana, commonly known as the Kowapian lily, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of New Guinea. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, with strap-like leaves and a short, stout stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
